topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: Switchtec-Specific Capability

body.p: Switchtec-Specific Extended Capability provides the ability for Indirect GAS access and Port Specific Events access.
body.note: Switchtec-Specific Capabiltity is only available for P2P bridge functions that have already bound with a physical port and NT EndPoint ( USP mode with NT EP Only ), and reserved for other functions.
body.p: This is a 512 bytes window, mapped to GAS based on the "Indirect GAS Access Window Offset" (0x0A00 - 0x0A03), (RW)
The indirect GAS Access Window is mapped to GAS using this offset, starting with the address of "this value * 512", (RW)
A write of 1b to initialize NT Crosslink Link Reset. The value read is always 0b

NT Crosslink Link Reset is only applicable to the NT crosslink port when link enable. NT crosslink port means the port is configuration to NT mode 1 and enable NT crosslink. NT crosslink link reset is used to make port link disable first, then make port link enable.
A set bit means there is a port event in the corresponding event slot, (RO)

p.b: AER in P2P Event Header Register (0x0C10 - 0x0C13)

body.p: Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit 4 - Fatal Error Event, firmware will stop running.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)

p.b: AER in P2P Event Data Registers (0x0C14 - 0x0C27)

body.p: 0-31: Uncorrectable Error Bit Offset = (Bit offset). Refer to “Uncorrectable Error Status Register” in AER capability to find which error each bit represents.
32-63: Correctable Error Bit Offset = (Bit Offset - 32) Refer to “Correctable Error Status Register” in AER capability to find which error each bit represents.
64-66: Switchtec Specific Additional Error Bit Offset = (Bit Offset - 64).
When the current uncorrectable error has its TLP header logged, based on PCIE Spec or is a "Switchtec Specific Additional Error", the TLP header is available here.

p.b: AER in vEP Event Header Register (0x0C28 - 0x0C2B)

body.p: Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit 4 - Fatal Error Event, firmware will stop running.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)

p.b: AER in vEP Event Data Registers (0x0C2C - 0x0C3F)

body.p: 0-31: Uncorrectable Error Bit Offset = (Bit offset). Refer to “Uncorrectable Error Status Register” in AER capability to find which error each bit represents.
32-63: Correctable Error Bit Offset = (Bit Offset - 32) Refer to “Correctable Error Status Register” in AER capability to find which error each bit represents.
64-66: Switchtec Specific Additional Error Bit Offset = (Bit Offset - 64).
When the current uncorrectable error has its TLP header logged, based on PCIE Spec or is a "Switchtec Specific Additional Error", the TLP header is available here.

p.ph: Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit 4 - Fatal Error Event, firmware will stop running.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)
Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 8 bytes are valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.
Bit[31:16]: Source ID, Only available when Trigger Reason is Fatal/Non-Fatal Message, (RO)
Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit 4 - Fatal Error Event, firmware will stop running.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)
Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 12 bytes are valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.
Bit[95:32]: The first two dwords of CTS related to TLP Header.
Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit 4 - Fatal Error Event, firmware will stop running.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)
Bit[15:0]: Source partition of the TLP that triggered UEC, (RO)
Bit[31:16]: Source port of the TLP that triggered UEC, (RO)
Bit[159:32]: The content of 3 DW or 4 DW TLP Header, (RO)

body.p: Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)
Takes up 20 bytes, in which the lower 4bits 4 bits in first 1 byte Byte is valid, and the others are reserved.
Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit 4 - Fatal Error Event, firmware will stop running.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)
Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 4 bytes are valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.
Bit 0 - SP IFB RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
Bit 1 - SP RST CAM Parity Error
Bit 2 - SP RST RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
Bit 4 - SP IED Incremental Parity Error
Bit 6 - SP EED Incremental Parity Error
Bit 7 - SP EED CAM Parity Error
Bit 8 - SC IFB Descriptor RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
Bit 9 - SC IFB DATA RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
Bit 12 - SC IFB Invalid TLP Header
Bit 13 - SC EFB Descriptor RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
Bit 14 - SC EFB DATA RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
Bit 17 - SC EFB Invalid TLP Header
Bit 18 - PL/DLL Transmit Packet Parity Error
Bit 19 - PL/DLL Replay Buffer RAM 2 Bit ECC Error
Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit 4 - Fatal Error Event, firmware will stop running.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)
Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 4 bytes are valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.
Bit 0 - Unsupported Request Error Enable. This is only for received Completion TLP with Unsupported Request status, (RO)
Bit 4 - Completer Abort Error, this is only for received Completion TLP with Completion Abort status, (RO)
Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)
Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 1 byte is valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.
Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)
Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 1 byte is valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved,
Bit 0 - PPU FW TLP throttling event, (RO)
Bit 1 - PPU DB TLP throttling event, (RO)
Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)
Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first 2 bytes are valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved,
0x0001 - Force Gen3 has been set, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen1.
0x0002 - Force Gen3 has been set, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen2.
0x0003 - Force Gen2 has been set, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen1.
0x0004 - Force Max Speed has been set, the device is Gen3 capable, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen1.
0x0005 - Force Max Speed has been set, the device is Gen3 capable, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen2.
0x0006 - Force Max Speed has been set, the device is Gen2 capable, but the current link rate during linkup is Gen1.
Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)

p.b: Link State Change Event Header Register: 0x0D30 - 0x0D33

body.p: Bit 1 - Logged in Firmware Event Log Module
Bit 3 - Report to sideband or in-band management host based on Event Report Control Register.
Bit[12:5]: Event occurring times since this event is cleared last time, (RO)

p.b: Link State Change Event Data Registers: 0x0D34 - 0x0D47

body.p: Takes up 20 bytes, in which the first byte is valid, and the remaining bytes are reserved.
Reserved for customers to implement up to 6 vendor-specific events, 24 bytes per event.
